thread.title: Trump’s Son-in-Law Positions Himself For White House Role
thread.title_full: Trump’s Son-in-Law Positions Himself For White House Role

author: Jack Davis
title: Trump’s Son-in-Law Positions Himself For White House Role

organizations.name: trump’s son-in-law positions himself for white house

text:
Sean Hannity Claims MSNBC Anchor Wants To Jump Ship To Fox 
A lawyer for Kushner said he has begun positioning himself for any appointment. 
“Mr. Kushner is committed to complying with federal ethics laws and we have been consulting with the Office of Government Ethics regarding the steps he would take,” said Jamie Gorelick, a partner at the law firm of WilmerHale, in a statement. 
“Although plans are not finalized, Mr. Kushner would resign from his position at Kushner Companies and divest substantial assets in accordance with federal guidelines,” he said. Advertisement - story continues below 
Kushner “would recuse from particular matters that would have a direct and predictable effect on his remaining financial interests. He would also abide by federal rules requiring impartiality in particular matters involving specific parties,” Gorelick said. 
Kushner is a real estate investor who acquired an estimated $7 billion in properties over the last 10 years. If he joins his father-in-law’s White House, he would divest his stake in a major Fifth Avenue skyscraper and other interests, said spokeswoman Risa Heller. 
Fox News reported that Kushner has also researching a federal anti-nepotism law. Although that law might seem to bar Ivanka Trump for many government jobs, some Trump transition officials have said the president has wide latitude to pick his staff. 
“The anti-nepotism law apparently has an exception if you want to work in the West Wing, because the president is able to appoint his own staff,” Trump adviser Kellyanne Conway has said. “The president does have discretion to choose a staff of his liking.” Advertisement - story continues below
